intro: Myosotis secunda, commonly known as the lesser forget-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Myosotis secunda is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also found in wildflower gardens.
